meanings.definition: To outmaneuver an opponent by moving around their flank.
meanings.sent1: The clever general outflanked the enemy by sneaking around their side.
meanings.sent2: The army outflanked the enemy forces and won the battle.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox outflanked the rabbit in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking outflanked the competition in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The skilled chess player outflanked their opponent with a surprising move.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in a strategic or tactical situation.
meanings.sent1: The student outflanked his classmates by scoring the highest on the test.
meanings.sent2: The company outflanked its competitors by launching a new marketing campaign.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outflanked the birds to get to the bird feeder first.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outflanked any obstacles in her path to success.
meanings.sent5: The athlete outflanked his own record by breaking a new personal best.
